title: How is zed considered fair?
body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dftxHN6z3NU&feature=youtu.be

He was level 1 and died from almost full hp with 4 auto attacks while he was stunned.  How is Zed considered to be balanced after something like that happens?

replies.body: Funny clip, but this belongs in Memes and Games, not Gameplay.

Gr8 Shitpost M8

All low elo zed players are trash, though.

but all high ELO players say Zed is trash

https://i.imgur.com/ljwFb6v.png[/img]

Yes.

Zed is good in low ELO, but his players are all awful and easily outplayed or baited. That video being a perfect example.

Zed is horrible in higher ELO, just like every other snowballing zero-utility assassin.
Not entirely true. Talon is good in high ELO  and he fits the "snowballing zero-utility assassin" archetype just as well
It's his feast or famine, and against anything CC heavy he just tanks. Not like Alistair, like the Titanic.

Being trash or not wouldn't have stopped that kill.  The only ways to have avoided that was to either just sit under tower literally all game or flashed the stun.  Do you really think someone would flash that stun with that HP value against someone most people call a troll pick because "he doesn't do damage"?

How is Zed fair? Well... as a Zed Main, I'll explain:

Stun
Snare
Silence
Knockup
Fear
Root
Grounded
Grounded
Fucking grounded.

If I grab Zed, and you pick anything not as mobile (thus Fizz, Ekko, sometimes Ahri, Talon. Etc) for mid, or your team declines to take hard CC because they all want to be "play makers?" I will eat your team and wait for you to FF at 20.

If your team is seemingly going CC heavy, I just wont pick him.

> [{quoted}](name=Cats Are Food,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GeQZAFui,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-12-16T07:41:52.752+0000)
>
> How is Zed fair? Well... as a Zed Main, I'll explain:
> 
> Stun
> Snare
> Silence
> Knockup
> Fear
> Root
> Grounded
> Grounded
> Fucking grounded.
> 
> If I grab Zed, and you pick anything not as mobile (thus Fizz, Ekko, sometimes Ahri, Talon. Etc) for mid, or your team declines to take hard CC because they all want to be "play makers?" I will eat your team and wait for you to FF at 20.
> 
> If your team is seemingly going CC heavy, I just wont pick him.

So you've explained perfectly why he's not, by explaining that there is no counterplay to him unless you've counter-picked him. And any time they do counter Zed you don't pick him.

No counter play? Go count how many champions have the abilities listed above. Count a second time to see how many have more than one of those. 

Seriously. If you think he lacks counterplay, you need to learn to play.

I get that the clip is meant to be funny, but I'm posting off the title like a jackass.

> [{quoted}](name=Cats Are Food,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GeQZAFui,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2018-12-16T07:49:15.362+0000)
>
> No counter play? Go count how many champions have the abilities listed above. Count a second time to see how many have more than one of those. 
> 
> Seriously. If you think he lacks counterplay, you need to learn to play.
> 
> I get that the clip is meant to be funny, but I'm posting off the title like a jackass.

No no no no no, you need to count only the ones who have such abilities _targeted_. That's the decider. If it were really as skewed against Zed as you say, he would constantly be underperforming. But that's simply not the case because his mobility can overcome most threats.

REALLY depends on the players you are against. Most players throw skillshot CC at where he is/leading where he is walking, despite the fact that he will either shadow, or ult a nearby squishy, every fight. Targetting his shadow, or during his ult animation cast CC at his target, will amost invariably stop his kill, if not lock him in place long enough to kill him.

Why I run Ahri/Ekko against my own main.

> [{quoted}](name=Cats Are Food,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GeQZAFui,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-16T08:00:38.783+0000)
>
> REALLY depends on the players you are against. Most players throw skillshot CC at where he is/leading where he is walking, despite the fact that he will either shadow, or ult a nearby squishy, every fight. Targetting his shadow, or during his ult animation cast CC at his target, will amost invariably stop his kill, if not lock him in place long enough to kill him.
> 
> Why I run Ahri/Ekko against my own main.

You're implying someone must have the knowledge of a Zed main to be able to counter him even with abilities that should.
People should gain knowledge of all the champions, even if just goofing around in ARAM, before considering one broken or lacking counter play. It tends to teach them how that champion gets countered.

> [{quoted}](name=Cats Are Food,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GeQZAFui,comment-id=0002000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-16T08:06:28.633+0000)
>
> People should gain knowledge of all the champions, even if just goofing around in ARAM, before considering one broken or lacking counter play. It tends to teach them how that champion gets countered.

Where the difference lies is that some champions require intricate knowledge of how to play them yourself in order to counter a main reliably, while most others only require basic knowledge. And most often, that's tied to how mobile they are.

EXACTLY. I feel, quite personally, that Volibear is %%%%%%edly over powered. This game seriously didn't need yet another broken champ from the days of DotA, who can instantly shift a teamfight by having more presence than the other four on his team. I also am not all that great with Volibear, and can barely play him... comparitively... and it's been that way since his release. It's subjective.
Are you actually trying to say Zed has no counterplay outside targeted CC?

> [{quoted}](name=Eedat,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GeQZAFui,comment-id=00020000000000000001,timestamp=2018-12-16T15:51:26.339+0000)
>
> Are you actually trying to say Zed has no counterplay outside targeted CC?

Not at all. But he has too much ability to play around it. Which makes it pretty loose to call it counterplay in the first place.

> [{quoted}](name=AlienPrimate,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GeQZAFui,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-12-16T06:14:51.822+0000)
>
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dftxHN6z3NU&amp;feature=youtu.be
> 
> He was level 1 and died from almost full hp with 4 auto attacks while he was stunned.  How is Zed considered to be balanced after something like that happens?

Literally no one cares that you can take Taric in a solo lane against players in normals or low elo who don't know how to play against it and cheese them.

Not a single person here.

Why do you never stop posting about it?

Because morons can't realize that all you have to do to counter all these assassins that they think are broken is pick anyone who is tanky with good base damage and CC.  They pick Zed or Talon?  Don't pick Lux or Zoe and complain that they one shot you.  Pick any of the following and make him cry in a corner.  Sure, they may not be meta but sheep refusing to break the meta is how all this "x is so broken and needs nerfs because I refuse to change the way I play to deal with x pick" happens.  {{champion:32}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:79}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:516}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:44}} {{champion:154}}

I will stop posting about it when Taric stops dumpstering all of these champions.  I have seen a complaint or advice on countering probably half of these in the past month and I beat all of these with Taric every single time.  Why does it matter that I play mostly normal games?  Beating these champions in a normal game is the exact same thing as beating them in a ranked game.  {{champion:266}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:240}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:27}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:223}}  {{champion:91}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:238}}

if you're being serious about this, your answer is the minion wave.

if you're not, well change the fucking category
LMAO
Just dodge. Shitgame, next.

This has what to do with the post?

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}
It has about as much relevance as taking Taric mid.
I take Taric mid every single time if I see Talon or Zed.  You just all in at level 2 and get first blood 95% of the time with 4 autos and ignite.

> [{quoted}](name=Dope Solo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GeQZAFui,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-12-16T06:20:20.274+0000)
>
> Just dodge. Shitgame, next.

You didn't even watch the clip. That's fucking hilarious. 

I think you should still downvote it, but because it's posted on the wrong board. Not because it's shit talking Zed-- because that's not what it's doing.
